pipeline_overview.description: Complete AI-assisted pipeline for preparing and submitting iOS apps to Apple App Store
pipeline_overview.reusability: Pipeline can be reused for any iOS app with minimal customization

phase_1_project_scan.title: Phase 1: Project Analysis & Policy Compliance Scan
phase_1_project_scan.description: AI scans project to identify policy violations BEFORE any work begins

tasks.task: Scan codebase for App Store policy violations
ai_actions: Search for private API usage (grep for private frameworks)
Detect payment flows (search for 'purchase', 'payment', 'unlock' keywords)
Verify IAP implementation if digital goods sold
Check for runtime code downloading (search for 'NSBundle', 'dlopen', 'eval')
Identify third-party SDKs (check Podfile, Package.swift, SPM dependencies)
Read app description from README or project docs
Identify primary features (health, finance, kids, gaming, etc.)
Determine appropriate App Store category
Flag special requirements (e.g., medical approval, financial licensing)

decision_points.health_app: Requires medical disclaimer, potentially FDA approval
decision_points.kids_app: Must comply with COPPA, remove analytics/ads
decision_points.gambling_app: Must geo-restrict, provide licensing per region

ai_actions: Search for account creation code â†’ verify account deletion exists
Search for social login (Facebook, Google) â†’ verify Sign in with Apple
Search for data collection â†’ verify privacy policy link
Search for HealthKit, Location â†’ verify purpose strings exist
Check Info.plist for permission descriptions
critical_checks: Sign in with Apple (if third-party login exists)

ai_actions: List all policy violations found
Prioritize fixes (critical vs optional)
Estimate effort for each fix
Create implementation roadmap
tasks.blocking_issues: Issues that MUST be fixed before submission

success_criteria: All required features present or planned
blockers: Private API usage detected â†’ must remove before proceeding
Missing IAP for digital goods â†’ must implement
Kids app with analytics â†’ must remove SDKs
Account creation without deletion â†’ must add feature

phase_2_app_icons.title: Phase 2: App Icon Generation & Validation
phase_2_app_icons.description: Generate App Store-compliant app icons at all required sizes

ai_actions: If source icon exists: validate size, format, transparency
If no icon: generate using AI image tools or request from designer
Verify icon follows HIG (no alpha channel, no text too small, recognizable at small sizes)
validation_rules: NO Apple hardware images (don't show iPhone/iPad)
NO Apple icons (no App Store icon, Settings icon replicas)

ai_actions: Use ImageMagick or sips to resize master icon
Generate iOS icons: 20pt@2x, 20pt@3x, 29pt@2x, 29pt@3x, 40pt@2x, 40pt@3x, 60pt@2x, 60pt@3x
Generate App Store icon: 1024x1024
If iPad support: generate iPad-specific sizes
If watchOS/macOS: generate platform-specific sizes
Edit Contents.json in AppIcon.appiconset
Map each icon size to correct filename
Set idiom (iphone, ipad, ios-marketing)
Verify all slots filled
Build app and check icon on device/simulator
Verify icon appears correctly on Home Screen
Check Settings icon (29pt)
Preview App Store icon (1024pt)
tasks.manual_check: Developer reviews icon on actual device

phase_3_screenshots.title: Phase 3: App Screenshot Capture & Optimization
phase_3_screenshots.description: Capture App Store screenshots for all required device sizes

ai_actions: Determine device support (iPhone only, or iPhone + iPad)
List required sizes based on devices
Plan screenshot content (show 5-10 key features)

required_sizes.iphone_6_7: 6.7" display (1290x2796 pixels) - iPhone 16 Pro Max, 15 Pro Max, 14 Pro Max
required_sizes.iphone_6_5: 6.5" display (1242x2688 pixels) - iPhone 15 Plus, 14 Plus, 13 Pro Max, 12 Pro Max

tasks.minimum_required: 1 set for largest iPhone size (6.7" or 6.5")

ai_actions: Launch app on required simulators
Navigate to key screens (onboarding, main features, settings)
Capture screenshots (Cmd+S on simulator, or Xcode â†’ Debug â†’ View Debugging â†’ Export Screenshots)
Ensure screenshots show app in use (NOT just splash screen)
screenshot_guidelines: Show actual app UI and content
First 3 screenshots appear in search results â†’ make them compelling
Each screenshot should highlight ONE key feature
Consider Dark Mode screenshots if supported
tasks.quantity: Up to 10 screenshots per device size

ai_actions: Optionally add text overlays to explain features
Ensure text readable and not too small
Maintain 4+ age rating (no violent/mature content visible)
Export final PNGs
tasks.best_practice: Simple screenshots often perform better than heavily designed ones

ai_actions: Create folder structure: screenshots/6.7inch/, screenshots/6.5inch/, etc.
Name files descriptively: 01_onboarding.png, 02_main_feature.png
Validate image specs (PNG/JPEG, correct dimensions)
Prepare captions for each screenshot (optional but recommended)
tasks.output: screenshots/ directory ready for App Store Connect upload

success_criteria: At least 1 screenshot set for largest iPhone size
All screenshots show app in use (not splash screens)

phase_4_metadata.title: Phase 4: App Store Metadata Creation & ASO
phase_4_metadata.description: Write compelling, accurate, and policy-compliant metadata

ai_actions: Analyze app purpose and target audience
Generate 5-10 name options
Check App Store for similar names (avoid confusion)
Ensure name is memorable, searchable, and descriptive
Verify character count â‰¤ 30
guidelines: NO pricing info, NO trademarked terms (unless authorized)

ai_actions: Summarize app in concise phrase
Highlight key value proposition
Avoid generic descriptions ('world's best app')
Focus on features or use cases
First sentence is CRITICAL (visible without 'read more')
Paragraph 1: Engaging overview of app value
Bullet list: Main features (5-7 bullets)
Additional paragraphs: Detail features, use cases
End: Optional accolade or call-to-action
NO keyword stuffing, NO pricing details, NO false claims

structure.opening: Compelling first sentence highlighting unique value
structure.features_list:
â€¢ Feature 1
â€¢ Feature 2
â€¢ Feature 3
structure.details: Expand on how features benefit user

ai_actions: Research relevant search terms users will use
Analyze competitor keywords (if public)
Balance popular terms vs niche terms
Separate with commas, NO spaces (except within phrases)
Avoid plurals if singular exists, avoid duplicates
Highlight latest news (limited-time sale, new features)
Can be updated WITHOUT submitting app update
Appears at top of description
tasks.example: ðŸŽ‰ New feature: Dark Mode now available! Update today.

tasks.task: Write What's New (for updates, max 4000 characters)
ai_actions: List changes in order of importance
Use bullet points for clarity
Mention bug fixes if significant
Generic text OK for minor updates ('Bug fixes and improvements')
tasks.example:
â€¢ Added Dark Mode support
â€¢ Improved performance
â€¢ Fixed crash on iOS 18

ai_actions: Review App Store Category Definitions
Select most relevant primary category (critical for discovery)
Optionally select secondary category
Ensure categories are accurate (Apple may change if wrong)
Verify keywords appear naturally in app name + subtitle + description
Check keyword density (not too high)
Ensure metadata targets right audience
Plan A/B testing with Product Page Optimization (after launch)

success_criteria: App name â‰¤ 30 chars, memorable, searchable
Keywords â‰¤ 100 chars, relevant, NO violations
phase_4_metadata.reference: See metadata.json and aso_optimization.json for detailed guidance

phase_5_privacy_compliance.title: Phase 5: Privacy Policy & Privacy Manifest
phase_5_privacy_compliance.description: Create privacy policy and Privacy Manifest (PrivacyInfo.xcprivacy)

tasks.task: Identify all data collection in app
ai_actions: Scan code for data collection (network requests, analytics SDKs, location usage)
List all data types collected (see Privacy Nutrition Label data types)
Identify third-party SDKs and their data collection
Check for tracking (ATT framework usage)
Use privacy policy generator or legal template
Include: what data collected, how used, who it's shared with
Include: data retention policy, user rights (access, deletion)
Include: contact information for privacy inquiries
Publish to accessible URL (website, not PDF)
requirements: MUST comply with GDPR, COPPA (if applicable)
MUST match Privacy Nutrition Label answers

ai_actions: Create PrivacyInfo.xcprivacy file in Xcode project root
Set NSPrivacyTracking (true if app tracks users)
List NSPrivacyTrackingDomains (domains used for tracking)
List NSPrivacyCollectedDataTypes (all data types app collects)
List NSPrivacyAccessedAPITypes (Required Reason APIs used)

tasks.task: Complete Privacy Nutrition Label in App Store Connect
ai_actions: Log into App Store Connect â†’ App Privacy
Answer all data collection questions
For each data type: specify usage purpose (Analytics, Advertising, App Functionality, etc.)
Indicate if data is linked to user identity
Indicate if data is used for tracking
Provide privacy policy URL
tasks.critical: Answers MUST match actual app behavior and privacy policy
tasks.output: Privacy Nutrition Label completed in App Store Connect

ai_actions: Add purpose strings to Info.plist (NSCameraUsageDescription, etc.)
Verify purpose strings clearly explain data use
Test permission prompts on device
Ensure app functions gracefully if permissions denied

success_criteria: Privacy Nutrition Label completed in App Store Connect

phase_6_final_build.title: Phase 6: Final Build, Testing & Archive
phase_6_final_build.description: Build, test, and archive app for App Store submission

ai_actions: Set CFBundleShortVersionString (e.g., '1.0.0') in Info.plist
Set CFBundleVersion (build number, e.g., '1') in Info.plist
Or use Xcode â†’ Target â†’ General â†’ Version / Build
Increment build number for each submission
Select Team in Xcode (Apple Developer account)
Choose 'Automatic Signing' or configure provisioning profiles
Verify Distribution certificate valid
Ensure App ID matches bundle identifier
tasks.output: Signing configured for App Store distribution

tasks.task: Run final tests on physical device
ai_actions: Install app on iPhone/iPad (not just simulator)
Test all major features and user flows
Verify no crashes or freezes
Test edge cases (no network, low battery, interruptions)
Verify in-app purchases work (sandbox environment)
Test on lowest supported iOS version
In Xcode: Product â†’ Archive
Wait for archive to complete (may take several minutes)
Verify archive appears in Organizer
Click 'Validate App' to check for issues
Fix any validation errors
validation_checks: No deprecated APIs (warnings OK, errors not)

tasks.task: Upload archive to App Store Connect
ai_actions: Click 'Distribute App' in Xcode Organizer
Select 'App Store Connect' distribution method
Select 'Upload'
Wait for upload (may take 10-30 minutes)
Verify build appears in App Store Connect â†’ TestFlight
tasks.output: Build uploaded and processing in App Store Connect

ai_actions: Monitor email for processing completion notification
Check App Store Connect for build status
If errors occur, review and fix issues, then re-upload

success_criteria: App tested on physical device with no crashes
Build uploaded to App Store Connect
blockers: Validation errors â†’ must fix code issues
Signing errors â†’ must configure certificates/profiles
Processing errors â†’ check email for details, fix and re-upload

phase_7_app_store_connect.title: Phase 7: App Store Connect Setup & Submission
phase_7_app_store_connect.description: Configure app in App Store Connect and submit for review

tasks.task: Create app record in App Store Connect
ai_actions: Log into App Store Connect â†’ My Apps
Click '+' â†’ New App
Select platform (iOS)
Enter app name (must match Xcode or be unique)
Select primary language
Enter bundle ID (must match Xcode project)
Enter SKU (unique identifier, e.g., 'com-yourcompany-appname')
tasks.output: App record created in App Store Connect

ai_actions: App Information â†’ Privacy Policy URL (enter URL)
App Information â†’ Category (select primary + optional secondary)
App Information â†’ Content Rights (who owns content)
Pricing and Availability â†’ Select price tier (or Free)
Pricing and Availability â†’ Select countries/regions
App Privacy â†’ Complete Privacy Nutrition Label (if not done in Phase 5)
Go to version (e.g., '1.0 Prepare for Submission')
Enter app name (30 chars max)
Enter subtitle (30 chars max)
Enter description (4000 chars max)
Enter keywords (100 chars max)
Enter promotional text (170 chars max, optional)
Enter support URL (required)
Enter marketing URL (optional)
For each device size: upload screenshots (drag and drop)
Optionally upload app preview videos (30 sec max)
Ensure first 3 screenshots are most compelling
Add screenshot captions (optional)
tasks.required: At least 1 screenshot set for largest iPhone size

ai_actions: Build â†’ Select uploaded build from dropdown
App Review Information â†’ Enter contact info (first name, last name, phone, email)
App Review Information â†’ Add demo account credentials (if login required)
App Review Information â†’ Add notes for reviewer (explain non-obvious features)
Version Release â†’ Select 'Automatically' or 'Manually'
tasks.critical: Demo account MUST work, backend services MUST be live

ai_actions: Answer age rating questionnaire
Be honest (wrong rating causes rejection)
If app has user-generated content, answer accordingly
Review all information for accuracy
Click 'Add for Review' (if IAPs exist, add them too)
Click 'Submit for Review'
Confirm submission
tasks.output: App submitted, status changes to 'Waiting for Review'

ai_actions: Check App Store Connect daily for status updates
Respond to App Review questions within 24 hours
If rejected: read rejection reasons, fix issues, resubmit
If approved: app goes live (automatically or manually)
tasks.output: App approved and live on App Store

success_criteria: App record created in App Store Connect
Build selected and review info complete
post_approval_actions: Track downloads and analytics in App Store Connect

phase_6: Build uploaded to App Store Connect

for_new_app: 1. Run Phase 1 scan on new project
2. Use same pipeline, customize metadata for new app
3. Generate new icons and screenshots specific to app
4. Update privacy policy for new data collection practices
for_app_update: 3. Update metadata: What's New, description if needed (Phase 4)
4. Update Privacy Manifest if data collection changed (Phase 5)
5. Build new version with incremented build number (Phase 6)
6. Submit update in App Store Connect (Phase 7)

fully_automatable: Phase 1: Project scan and policy validation
Phase 2: Icon generation from master file
Phase 5: Privacy Manifest creation from code scan
semi_automatable: Phase 3: Screenshot capture (AI can navigate app, human reviews quality)
Phase 6: Build and archive (AI can run commands, human monitors)
Phase 7: App Store Connect data entry (AI can fill forms, human submits)
manual_required: Final submission click in App Store Connect
